case_vignette: A 2-day-old female is noted to have    a rash all over the body and distorted feet at birth. A 24 week ultrasound was remarkable for bilateral shortening of the l   ong bones   . Physical examination demonstrates l ight, fine yellow    scales along curvilinear distribution on  the chest, bilateral upper and lower extremities on background diffuse erythema. The bil   ateral feet are turned inward with plantar asp ect almost sideways. An X-ray of the knees demonstrate focal dot-like calcifications in the epiphyses.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash all over my body and my feet are turned inward almost sideways.
How long have you had these symptoms?
I have had these symptoms since birth, so for 2 days.
Does anyone in your family have similar symptoms or have been diagnosed with a genetic disorder?
I'm not aware of anyone in my family having similar symptoms or a genetic disorder.
Do you notice any issues with muscle tone, or do the abnormal feet positions cause difficulty in movement?
As a 2-day-old, I haven't started moving much yet, but my feet are turned inward which might cause difficulty in movement as I grow.
Final Diagnosis: Arthrogryposis Multiplex Congenita (AMC)

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash all over my body and my feet are turned inward almost sideways.
How long have you had these symptoms?
I've had these symptoms since birth, so for 2 days.
Do you have any family history of genetic disorders or similar symptoms?
I'm not aware of any family history of genetic disorders or similar symptoms.
Has any diagnostic testing or physical examination been done by a healthcare professional since birth?

Yes, an ultrasound at 24 weeks showed shortening of long bones and a physical examination found light, fine yellow scales and a wide-spread rash. An X-ray also showed tiny dot-like calcifications in the knee areas.
Final Diagnosis: Conradi-Hünermann syndrome.
